Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Do you thrive on data and turning complex information into actionable insights that drive real business impact? Are you a seasoned analyst with a proven track record of success in a fast-paced marketing environment? If so, we're looking for you!

In this pivotal role, you will take ownership of the data that fuels our marketing success. You will be responsible for developing and executing a robust data strategy, gathering, analyzing, and synthesizing data from various sources, and translating complex findings into clear, actionable insights that inform and guide our marketing decisions. You will be a key partner to marketing leadership, providing data-driven recommendations and driving continuous improvement across all marketing channels.

In this role, you'll be responsible for:


Leading the development and implementation of a comprehensive marketing data strategy
Defining, tracking, and reporting on key marketing KPIs. 
Working with marketing, sales, and finance leadership to set goals
Analyzing the performance and attribution of all marketing channels, including paid, organic, email, social, and content, identifying trends and opportunities for optimization
Designing and executing A/B testing and other experiments to continuously improve marketing performance
Developing and maintaining intuitive dashboards and reports that provide actionable insights to stakeholders across the organization
Gathering, normalizing, and integrating data from various sources, including CRM systems, marketing automation platforms, web analytics, and social media platforms
Collaborating closely with marketing and product teams to help develop customer-centric strategies and drive data-informed decision-making
Proactively identifying areas for data improvement and automation, streamlining processes and increasing efficiency
Staying abreast of the latest marketing technology and data analysis trends

The team you will be joining: 

This multi-talented inbound marketing and ecommerce team consists of digital marketers, writers, designers and communications experts who endeavor to show the world why OnLogic is the first choice in Industrial Computing. You'll find them developing marketing campaigns, producing stunning product catalogs, curating our social media channels, penning website content and laughing daily at each other's terrible jokes. They're a collaborative crew that works hard to position the brand, generate demand and deliver a delightful customer experience
Learn more about Life at OnLogic.



Requirements


3+ years of proven experience in a marketing data analyst role, with a strong track record of success in a fast-paced, data-driven environment
Expertise in building and maintaining scalable marketing reports and dashboards using a variety of tools, including business intelligence platforms and data visualization tools such as PowerBI
Experience with data lakes (BigQuery)
Experience with Google Analytics
Strong proficiency in  SQL and DAX as the primary query languages
Strong proficiency in Excel, Google Sheets, and scripting languages for data analysis (e.g., Python, R)
Proven ability to analyze complex data sets, identify trends, and communicate findings effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences
Satisfactory completion of a background check
Ability to work in the U.S. without visa sponsorship



Who we're looking for:


Experience training and mentoring marketing teams on data analysis techniques and best practices
A strong understanding of marketing principles, including customer segmentation, campaign planning, and performance measurement
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills
A proactive, results-oriented mindset with a strong work ethic and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment



Who we are:



OnLogic is growing, and we want to give you the same opportunity to grow in your career! We design and manufacture specialized computers and hardware solutions for companies all over the world, helping them to make the seemingly impossible possible. Our computers are designed to work where others would fail, and it's our vision to be the first choice in industrial computing. To make that vision a reality, we've built a team of ambitious problem solvers, guided by the company's core values of Open, Fair, Innovative and Independent. We have an open office, open salaries and strive to be fair and transparent in our decision making. We encourage input and feedback from every member of our team and look to improve ourselves and our business every single day.

Diversity is an essential element of our core values. Not just respecting, but actively embracing a variety of backgrounds, life experiences, and opinions, helps us foster innovation, enhances our problem-solving capabilities, and promotes learning and engagement among the members of our team. We strongly encourage those with diverse backgrounds to apply.


We are committed to providing a safe, inclusive, and harassment-free workplace for all employees. We do not tolerate any form of harassment, discrimination, or bias based on race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, religion, disability, age, or any other protected characteristic.


To learn more about our values, our mission and what it's like to work at OnLogic, visit www.onlogic.com/careers.



Benefits




The salary range for this role is $75,000 to $85,000. We determine final compensation based on discussions with applicants and their experience in similar roles. 

A competitive Salary based upon your experience and the requirements of the role
A comprehensive Benefits package
401k Plan with 3% Employer Contribution
An Annual Profit Share Bonus 
Paid Maternity & Paternity Leave, and Short & Long Term Disability
Opportunity to Participate in our Employee Stock Purchase Plan
A personal development plan created to help you (and us) grow
Show more

Title: Staff Data Analyst
Description:
About the Staff Data Analyst at Headspace:




We are looking for an experienced and strategic Staff Data Analyst to join our Data team. In this role, you will lead the measurement and delivery of insights and actionable recommendations that drive performance improvements in key areas such as enrollment, activation, engagement, retention, and member outcomes.




As a senior leader, you will work closely with cross-functional partners, including Engineering, Product Design, Product Management, Product Marketing, and Operations, to influence the planning, development, launch, and growth of our Channel offerings. This is a highly visible role that requires exceptional analytical expertise, strategic thinking, and the ability to translate business priorities into impactful analytics initiatives.




By driving data-driven decision-making, you will play a pivotal role in helping us achieve our mission of providing everyone with access to lifelong mental health support.




What you will do:





Strategic Leadership: Drive significant business outcomes by leading impactful and complex data projects that align with strategic priorities.


Cross-Functional Partnership: Provide thought leadership by collaborating with cross-functional teams to translate complex business problems into scalable analytical frameworks. Recommend and implement actionable insights that drive measurable results.


Analytical Expertise: Serve as the organization's subject matter expert on advanced statistical analysis, experimental design, methodology, and financial impact analysis, ensuring best practices are followed.


Problem Solving: Lead root cause analyses for critical business metrics, crafting structured approaches to identify and address key drivers. Facilitate discussions with senior stakeholders and teams to prioritize and implement optimization strategies.


Process Automation: Architect and implement automation solutions for analytical processes, including experimentation readouts and self-service analytics, improving scalability and efficiency.


Data Products Development: Lead the development of high-quality data product requirements, dashboard scopes, and automated reporting solutions. Build strong partnerships with Data Engineering, Business Intelligence, and other data stakeholders.


Visionary Collaboration: Partner with Business Intelligence engineering teams to drive both immediate data initiatives and the long-term vision for data-driven reporting and metric frameworks.


Project Ownership: Independently identify opportunities for improvement or growth, initiate projects, and lead them to successful outcomes with measurable impact.


Storytelling & Communication: Deliver compelling presentations to cross-functional teams and executive leadership, showcasing data-driven insights with clarity and precision.





What you will bring:




Required Skills:





8+ years of well-rounded analytics experience, ideally with exposure to Digital Health, high-growth SaaS, and/or Mental Health industries in rapid growth environments.


6+ years of experience working directly with executive leadership and product leaders, showcasing the ability to align analytics with strategic goals.


8+ years of analytics experience focused on customer growth, engagement, and lifecycle optimization.


6+ years of experience owning and managing data products while driving their strategic utilization to create business impact.


8+ years of expertise in big data technologies (e.g., Redshift, S3, Databricks, Datalakes, Spark).






Advanced skills in SQL, Python, R, Looker, Tableau, Statistics, Amplitude, Domo, CoreMetrics, Google Analytics, and Excel.


Required expertise in SQL, Python, Looker, Tableau, Statistics, and Amplitude for event-based deep dives and advanced analytics.


Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, or a related quantitative field.


This role demands a highly skilled analytics professional with deep technical expertise and a proven ability to lead complex, strategic projects. Candidates should demonstrate strong communication skills, strategic thinking, and a passion for driving measurable outcomes in dynamic, growth-oriented environments.





Preferred Skills:





4+ years of progressive experience in healthcare analytics.





Pay & Benefits:




The base salary range for this role is determined by a number of factors, including but not limited to skills and scope required, relevant licensure and certifications, and unique relevant experience and job-related skills. The base salary range for this role is $131,414 - $197,100.




At Headspace, cash salary is but one component of our Total Rewards package. We’re proud of our robust package inclusive of: base salary, stock awards, comprehensive healthcare coverage, monthly wellness stipend, retirement savings match, lifetime Headspace membership, unlimited, free mental health coaching, generous parental leave, and much more. Paid performance incentives are also included for those in eligible roles. Additional details about our Total Rewards package will be provided during the recruitment process.




How we feel about Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging:




Headspace is committed to bringing together humans from different backgrounds and perspectives, providing employees with a safe and welcoming work environment free of discrimination and harassment. We strive to create a diverse & inclusive environment where everyone can thrive, feel a sense of belonging, and do impactful work together. 




As an equal opportunity employer, we prohibit any unlawful discrimination against a job applicant on the basis of their race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, family or parental status, disability*, age, veteran status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We respect the laws enforced by the EEOC and are dedicated to going above and beyond in fostering diversity across our workplace. 




*Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing undue hardship on Headspace. Please inform our Talent team by filling out this form if you need any assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application or interview process.





Headspace participates in the E-Verify Program.




Privacy Statement




All member records are protected according to our Privacy Policy. Further, while employees of Headspace (formerly Ginger) cannot access Headspace products/services, they will be offered benefits according to the company's benefit plan. To ensure we are adhering to best practice and ethical guidelines in the field of mental health, we take care to avoid dual relationships. A dual relationship occurs when a mental health care provider has a second, significantly different relationship with their client in addition to the traditional client-therapist relationship—including, for example, a managerial relationship.  




As such, Headspace requests that individuals who have received coaching or clinical services at Headspace wait until their care with Headspace is complete before applying for a position. If someone with a Headspace account is hired for a position, please note their account will be deactivated and they will not be able to use Headspace services for the duration of their employment. 




Further, if Headspace cannot find a role that fails to resolve an ethical issue associated with a dual relationship, Headspace may need to take steps to ensure ethical obligations are being adhered to, including a delayed start date or a potential leave of absence. Such steps would be taken to protect both the former member, as well as any relevant individuals from their care team, from impairment, risk of exploitation, or harm.




For how how we will use the personal information you provide as part of the application process, please see: https://www.headspace.com/applicant-notice

Show more
HTML:
About the Staff Data Analyst at Headspace:


We are looking for an experienced and strategic Staff Data Analyst to join our Data team. In this role, you will lead the measurement and delivery of insights and actionable recommendations that drive performance improvements in key areas such as enrollment, activation, engagement, retention, and member outcomes.


As a senior leader, you will work closely with cross-functional partners, including Engineering, Product Design, Product Management, Product Marketing, and Operations, to influence the planning, development, launch, and growth of our Channel offerings. This is a highly visible role that requires exceptional analytical expertise, strategic thinking, and the ability to translate business priorities into impactful analytics initiatives.


By driving data-driven decision-making, you will play a pivotal role in helping us achieve our mission of providing everyone with access to lifelong mental health support.


What you will do:



  • Strategic Leadership: Drive significant business outcomes by leading impactful and complex data projects that align with strategic priorities.

  • Cross-Functional Partnership: Provide thought leadership by collaborating with cross-functional teams to translate complex business problems into scalable analytical frameworks. Recommend and implement actionable insights that drive measurable results.

  • Analytical Expertise: Serve as the organization's subject matter expert on advanced statistical analysis, experimental design, methodology, and financial impact analysis, ensuring best practices are followed.

  • Problem Solving: Lead root cause analyses for critical business metrics, crafting structured approaches to identify and address key drivers. Facilitate discussions with senior stakeholders and teams to prioritize and implement optimization strategies.

  • Process Automation: Architect and implement automation solutions for analytical processes, including experimentation readouts and self-service analytics, improving scalability and efficiency.

  • Data Products Development: Lead the development of high-quality data product requirements, dashboard scopes, and automated reporting solutions. Build strong partnerships with Data Engineering, Business Intelligence, and other data stakeholders.

  • Visionary Collaboration: Partner with Business Intelligence engineering teams to drive both immediate data initiatives and the long-term vision for data-driven reporting and metric frameworks.

  • Project Ownership: Independently identify opportunities for improvement or growth, initiate projects, and lead them to successful outcomes with measurable impact.

  • Storytelling & Communication: Deliver compelling presentations to cross-functional teams and executive leadership, showcasing data-driven insights with clarity and precision.


What you will bring:


Required Skills:



  • 8+ years of well-rounded analytics experience, ideally with exposure to Digital Health, high-growth SaaS, and/or Mental Health industries in rapid growth environments.

  • 6+ years of experience working directly with executive leadership and product leaders, showcasing the ability to align analytics with strategic goals.

  • 8+ years of analytics experience focused on customer growth, engagement, and lifecycle optimization.

  • 6+ years of experience owning and managing data products while driving their strategic utilization to create business impact.

  • 8+ years of expertise in big data technologies (e.g., Redshift, S3, Databricks, Datalakes, Spark).



  • Advanced skills in SQL, Python, R, Looker, Tableau, Statistics, Amplitude, Domo, CoreMetrics, Google Analytics, and Excel.

  • Required expertise in SQL, Python, Looker, Tableau, Statistics, and Amplitude for event-based deep dives and advanced analytics.

  • Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, statistics, mathematics, or a related quantitative field.

  • This role demands a highly skilled analytics professional with deep technical expertise and a proven ability to lead complex, strategic projects. Candidates should demonstrate strong communication skills, strategic thinking, and a passion for driving measurable outcomes in dynamic, growth-oriented environments.


Preferred Skills:



  • 4+ years of progressive experience in healthcare analytics.


Pay & Benefits:


The base salary range for this role is determined by a number of factors, including but not limited to skills and scope required, relevant licensure and certifications, and unique relevant experience and job-related skills. The base salary range for this role is $131,414 - $197,100.


At Headspace, cash salary is but one component of our Total Rewards package. We’re proud of our robust package inclusive of: base salary, stock awards, comprehensive healthcare coverage, monthly wellness stipend, retirement savings match, lifetime Headspace membership, unlimited, free mental health coaching, generous parental leave, and much more. Paid performance incentives are also included for those in eligible roles. Additional details about our Total Rewards package will be provided during the recruitment process.


How we feel about Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging:


Headspace is committed to bringing together humans from different backgrounds and perspectives, providing employees with a safe and welcoming work environment free of discrimination and harassment. We strive to create a diverse & inclusive environment where everyone can thrive, feel a sense of belonging, and do impactful work together. 


As an equal opportunity employer, we prohibit any unlawful discrimination against a job applicant on the basis of their race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, family or parental status, disability*, age, veteran status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. We respect the laws enforced by the EEOC and are dedicated to going above and beyond in fostering diversity across our workplace. 


*Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the terms of the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing undue hardship on Headspace. Please inform our Talent team by filling out this form if you need any assistance completing any forms or to otherwise participate in the application or interview process.



Headspace participates in the E-Verify Program.


Privacy Statement


All member records are protected according to our Privacy Policy. Further, while employees of Headspace (formerly Ginger) cannot access Headspace products/services, they will be offered benefits according to the company's benefit plan. To ensure we are adhering to best practice and ethical guidelines in the field of mental health, we take care to avoid dual relationships. A dual relationship occurs when a mental health care provider has a second, significantly different relationship with their client in addition to the traditional client-therapist relationship—including, for example, a managerial relationship.  


As such, Headspace requests that individuals who have received coaching or clinical services at Headspace wait until their care with Headspace is complete before applying for a position. If someone with a Headspace account is hired for a position, please note their account will be deactivated and they will not be able to use Headspace services for the duration of their employment. 


Further, if Headspace cannot find a role that fails to resolve an ethical issue associated with a dual relationship, Headspace may need to take steps to ensure ethical obligations are being adhered to, including a delayed start date or a potential leave of absence. Such steps would be taken to protect both the former member, as well as any relevant individuals from their care team, from impairment, risk of exploitation, or harm.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

We are seeking a skilled and motivated Senior Data Analyst to join our Growth Analytics team. In this role, you will support our marketing team by managing data quality, data ETL pipelines, creating impactful dashboards, and analyzing complex datasets to uncover insights and support data-driven decision-making for our mobile games. The ideal candidate is a strategic thinker with strong technical skills, a passion for gaming, and extensive experience in marketing analytics.




Key Responsibilities:




ETL Development & Maintenance:
Build and maintain scalable ETL pipelines with our data engineers to extract, clean, and transform data from multiple sources (internal and third-party platforms).
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and availability to support business needs.
Dashboard Creation & Reporting:
Develop interactive dashboards using Tableau and Looker to provide stakeholders with real-time performance insights.
Automate reporting processes to improve efficiency and reduce manual efforts.
In-Depth Analysis:
Conduct deep dives into marketing data to identify performance trends, audience behaviors, and opportunities for optimization.
Collaboration & Communication:
Act as the data expert for the marketing team, collaborating with data engineers, UA managers, and product teams.
Present findings in a clear, concise, and actionable manner to non-technical stakeholders.
Additional Skills & Qualifications
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP) is preferred.
Strong understanding of performance marketing metrics (ROAS, CPI, CAC) and user behavior tracking.
Experience with attribution tools such as AppsFlyer or Singular.
Exceptional communication and storytelling skills to convey insights effectively.
Strong project management and collaboration abilities.

Title: Data Visualization Specialist
Description:
Onebridge is a Consulting firm with an HQ in Indianapolis, and clients dispersed throughout the United States and beyond. We have an exciting opportunity for a highly skilled Data Visualization Specialist to join an innovative and dynamic group of professionals at a company rated among the top “Best Places to Work” in Indianapolis since 2015.




Employment Type: Full Time or Contract

Location: Indianapolis, IN - Hybrid | Required Onsite 2-3 days per week

Industry: IT & Services, Data & Analytics, Healthcare.




Data Visualization Specialist | About You

As a Data Visualization Specialist, you will be responsible for transforming complex data into actionable, visually compelling insights through interactive dashboards. You will collaborate with technical teams and stakeholders to track progress, monitor key metrics, and identify areas for improvement. With your expertise in Power BI, you will design and automate dashboards that provide real-time updates on performance and trends. Your ability to present data in a clear, accessible way will help drive informed decision-making and optimize business processes.




Data Visualization Specialist | Day-to-Day

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business needs and tailor dashboards to meet specific reporting requirements.
Design and develop interactive Power BI dashboards to track key performance metrics and business progress.
Visualize complex datasets in an intuitive and user-friendly manner to enable data-driven decision-making across the organization.
Monitor trends and potential issues through dashboards, providing leadership with real-time updates on performance.
Automate reporting processes to improve the efficiency, accuracy, and consistency of data tracking and reporting.
Ensure the quality, consistency, and reliability of data across all visualizations and reports.




Data Visualization Specialist | Skills & Experience

5+ years of experience as a Data Visualization Specialist or in a similar role.
Strong expertise in Power BI for creating dynamic, interactive dashboards and reports.
Proficiency in data manipulation, visualization techniques, and ensuring clarity and actionable insights.
Experience working with large datasets and integrating data from multiple sources.
High attention to detail with a focus on presenting data in visually compelling and easy-to-understand formats.
Excellent collaboration skills, with the ability to work closely with technical teams and business stakeholders.
Knowledge of statistical concepts and data analysis techniques to ensure meaningful visualization of data.




A Best Place to Work in Indiana since 2015

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Title: Data Analyst

Location: Carmel, IN 46032

Schedule: 3 days on 2 off hybrid

Duration: 12 month Contract potential extensions and conversion

Must Haves:

2-5 years experience in Data Analytics
Experience with SQL and Python
Power BI experience
Bachelor’s Degree in related field

Plusses:

Experience working with Microsoft Dynamics CRM
Experience or familiarity with Energy Industry

Day to Day:

Insight Global is seeking a Data Analyst to join one of our largest clients in Carmel, IN. The primary responsibilities include developing, managing, analyzing, evaluating, and reporting Generation Interconnection data. This position leverages data, understanding of the generation interconnection process and a facilitative mind-set to aid in the development and coordination of data automation, data quality, dashboards, and forecasting. This individual will contribute heavily to the continued build out of our client’s tools – CRM Platform and Online Application tool GIAA. The individual will need to have extensive experience of working with a range of tools and packages to interrogate data and build reports.




Compensation:

$30/hr to $45/hr.

Exact compensation may vary based on several factors, including skills, experience, and education.

Benefit packages for this role will start on the 1st day of employment and include medical, dental, and vision insurance, as well as HSA, FSA, and DCFSA account options, and 401k retirement account access with employer matching. Employees in this role are also entitled to paid sick leave and/or other paid time off as provided by applicable law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Day to Day:

A client of Insight Global is looking to bring on a Data Analyst to join their Merchandising Support & Analytics team supporting data analysis for online products. This individual will be responsible for managing the data for various business lines. For each of these groups there is specific product data that must be analyzed to forecast how it is being promoted, priced, what volume needs to be available, etc. This information must then be presented back to the internal stakeholders with business recommendations.




Requirements:

2-4 years of experience as a Data Analyst (merchandising background would be ideal)
Advanced excel (Pivot Tables, VLOOKUPS)
Familiar with PowerPoint for data visualization
Experience working with high level internal stakeholders (presenting data finding and making business recommendations)
Ability to recognize how tasks rank in order of urgency to prioritize time
Overall good business acumen and ability to communicate effectively
Ability to work independently and problem solve




Plus:

Data Analytics certification
SQL, Tableau

Title: Data Fulfillment Analyst
Description:
WORK OPTION: 4 days a week in the New York, NY office

The National Basketball Association (NBA) is a global sports and media organization with the mission to inspire and connect people everywhere through the power of basketball.  Built around five professional sports leagues:  the NBA, WNBA, NBA G League, NBA 2K League and Basketball Africa League, the NBA has established a major international presence with games and programming available in 214 countries and territories in 60 languages, and merchandise for sale in more than 200 countries and territories on all seven continents.  NBA rosters at the start of the 2023-24 season featured a record 125 international players from 40 countries and territories.  NBA Digital’s assets include NBA TV, NBA.com, the NBA App and NBA League Pass.  The NBA has created one of the largest social media communities in the world, with more than 2.3 billion likes and followers globally across all leagues, team and player platforms.  NBA Cares, the NBA’s global social responsibility platform, partners with renowned community-based organizations around the world to address important social issues in the areas of education, inclusion, youth and family development, and health and wellness.

At the NBA, we're passionate about growing and celebrating the game of basketball. Through the intensity of the game and the amazing athletic skill of our players, we deliver excitement to hundreds of millions of fans around the world.

As a global sports and media business, the NBA is so much more. While Basketball Operations runs the league's on-court activities, other departments manage relationships with television and digital media partners, develop marketing partnerships with some of the world's most recognizable companies, oversee the licensing of NBA merchandise, and handle a wide range of responsibilities that drive the NBA's success.

Essential Functions And Job Summary

The Data Fulfillment Analyst will be responsible for helping to facilitate the use of the NBA’s vast fan data, data strategy, and digital marketing and technology capabilities to enable our partners to use these assets to grow their business. The set of partners will vary greatly and will include those from the retail, strategic, content and marketing partnership spaces creating an opportunity to work with a diverse mix of brands and business. The ideal candidate is customer and project focused and enjoys the challenges of working across functions with team members from Data Strategy, Global Partnerships & Media, Direct-To-Consumer, Legal and Data Engineering. You will draw on your experience across digital marketing, data analysis and AdTech/MarTech to solve complex problems that drive value to both the NBA and its partners.

Major Responsibilities


Apply subject matter expertise to develop and deliver digital marketing strategies and programs that accelerate customer acquisition, retention and brand awareness for partner data collaboration projects
Consult with the Global Partnerships & Media team and with peers on the Technology & Platform Strategy team on the right mix of tactics to deliver the partners’ objectives (pre-sales)
Lead the execution of tactics defined by the Global Partnership & Media team for each partner (post-sales)
Lead the implementation of data cleanroom solutions including setup and configuration
Provide support and guidance to internal and external stakeholders on data requirements and optimal implementation
Collaborate with partners on data overlap analysis, segmentation and audience development
Ensure marketable audiences are successfully onboarded to ad platforms (e.g., Meta, Google, etc.) for ad targeting
Make optimization recommendations based on partner objectives and performance
Manage project from start to finish to ensure that all facets of the partner agreement have been successfully followed
Responsible for keeping a pulse on trends in marketing/ad technology and marketing operations


Required Education/Professional Experience


2+ years of experience working in AdTech, product operations, product management, or a technical marketing operations capacity
Bachelor’s degree required


Required Skills/Knowledge Attributes


Experience with CRM platform technology and data structures
Demonstrated SQL skills required
Proficiency with evaluating data in Microsoft Excel required with abilities to leverage statistical programming software (e.g., R) to manipulated larger data sets [preferred / a plus]
Knowledge of clean room technology and data onboarding tools
Understanding of how to use common tools to conduct measurement of marketing performance and how to communicate results to stakeholders with varying levels of expertise in data
Expert at problem-solving and critical thinking
Ability to successfully navigate cross-functional teams and prioritize across competing needs
Strong written and verbal communication skills


Salary Range: $100,000 - $115,000

Job Posting Title: Manager

The NBA does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firms or any other third parties. Any unsolicited resume sent to the NBA will be considered NBA property, and the NBA will not pay a fee should it hire the subject of any unsolicited resume.

The NBA considers applicants for all positions on the basis of merit, qualifications, and business needs, and without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, alienage or citizenship status, ancestry, marital status, genetic predisposition or carrier status, veteran status, familial status, status as a victim of domestic violence, or any other status or characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

About The NBA

The National Basketball Association (NBA) is a global sports and media organization with the mission to inspire and connect people everywhere through the power of basketball.  Built around five professional sports leagues:  the NBA, WNBA, NBA G League, NBA 2K League and Basketball Africa League, the NBA has established a major international presence with games and programming available in 215 countries and territories in more than 50 languages, and merchandise for sale in more than 200 countries and territories on all seven continents.  NBA rosters at the start of the 2021-22 season featured a record 121 international players from 40 countries.  NBA Digital’s assets include NBA TV, NBA.com, the NBA App and NBA League Pass.  The NBA has created one of the largest social media communities in the world, with 2.1 billion likes and followers globally across all league, team, and player platforms.  Through NBA Cares, the league addresses important social issues by working with internationally recognized youth-serving organizations that support education, youth and family development, and health-related causes.

Title: Operations Analyst, Investigations & Response
Description:
Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with 283 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.

As Netflix continues to grow, we are looking for a talented team member to join the Customer Service team as an Investigations & Response Operations Analyst.

In this role, you’ll play a critical role in overseeing the governance program and ensuring operational excellence through quality assurance and metrics development. This position requires strong data analytics, strategic thinking, and the ability to convey insights effectively. You will be responsible for conducting audits, creating key metrics, and supporting day-to-day operations in collaboration with Investigations & Response Leaders and cross-functional stakeholders across Customer Service, Legal, and other teams.

The environment is fast-paced, requiring an ability to work independently and autonomously. You will need to demonstrate strong operational acumen, keen attention to detail, objective and consistent judgment. It is fundamental for you to be well-versed in QA, data analytics and project management; you will also have master problem-solving and organizational skills with the ability to multi-task across varying business needs and conflicting priorities. This role is both tactical and strategic, and reports to the Investigations & Response Operations Program Manager.

Key Responsibilities


Governance & Quality Assurance: Oversee the governance program and conduct audits to ensure adherence to quality standards and regulatory compliance.
Metrics Development: Develop and manage core metrics and KPIs to monitor I&R operations, ensuring insights are accessible to stakeholders.
Data Extraction & Storytelling: Responsible for extracting and analyzing data to support the process of Quarterly Business Review (QBR) and Monthly Business Review (MBR, with a focus on effectively presenting insights. Collaborate with the I&R team to utilize data in uncovering meaningful trends, and identifying reasons behind volume and metric changes.
Operational Support: Partner with I&R Lead managers to support day-to-day operations management, playbook review, and workflow management prioritization.
Continuous Improvement: Enhance and refine existing metrics and governance processes, implementing tailored tooling solutions to improve auditing efficiency.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Collaborating with teams such as Legal, Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A), and Workforce Management (WFM) to analyze efficiency and cost metrics.
Communication & Documentation: Maintain clear documentation of processes, dashboards, and governance protocols to ensure transparency and accessibility.


Required Skills


Advanced Data Skills: Proficiency in Tableau for creating queries and dashboards, and expertise in Excel and Google Sheets.
Data Storytelling: Ability to convey data insights clearly and effectively to various stakeholders.
Strategic Thinking: Capacity to think globally and strategically to align with business objectives.
Quality Assurance: Strong skills in conducting audits and maintaining quality standards.
Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills essential for stakeholder engagement.
Attention to Detail: Precision in data analysis and reporting for accuracy and reliability.
Change Management: Ability to adapt to and manage changes in processes, technology, or business needs.


Qualifications


3+ years of experience in data analytics, quality assurance, or governance roles, preferably within Customer Service, Regulatory Compliance, Fraud, Trust and Safety, or similar industries.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills, with the ability to review high-complexity data across multiple tools, connect the dots, and identify trends
Proven track record of enhancing operational processes and metrics.
Solid data analytics experience, from querying big data sets to building operational dashboards in order to monitor core metrics and quality output
Extended proficiency with Google Workplace, especially Google Sheet advanced features - including Pivot tables, Sheet APIs, App Script, VLOOKUP formulas, etc
Advanced proficiency in Tableau for data visualization and dashboard creation.
Superior knowledge of Zendesk - including its administrative roles - in addition to other Customer Service tools and Project Management software (Asana/Airtable)
Superior organizational skills, extraordinary attention to detail, and a ‘challenge-the-status-quo’ mindset that processes can always be improved
Self-starter and fast learner who can work independently while using impeccable judgment
Ability to adapt to business needs and thrive in a fast-paced environment with shifting priorities, while successfully managing multiple tasks and high-visibility projects with strict deadlines
Receptive to and able to appropriately incorporate real-time feedback


Generally, our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $50,000 - $190,000.

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here.

Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here.

Inclusion is a Netflix value and we strive to host a meaningful interview experience for all candidates. If you want an accommodation/adjustment for a disability or any other reason during the hiring process, please send a request to your recruiting partner.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

Title: Analyst/Junior Associate Analytics
Description:
ANALYST/JUNIOR ASSOCIATE, ANALYTICS & DEBT

JOB DESCRIPTION




Company Background

Founded in 1993, DivcoWest is a multi-disciplinary real estate investment firm headquartered in San Francisco, with offices in Los Angeles, Menlo Park, Boston, Washington DC, Austin, and New York City. Known for our long-standing relationships and track record of success in innovation markets, DivcoWest combines entrepreneurial spirit with an institutional approach.




DivcoWest aims to create environments that inspire ingenuity, promote growth, and enhance the health, happiness, and well-being of all people. A disciplined code of ethics is at the core of all that we do. We believe that the collective energy of a diverse team is what drives our creative ideas and solutions.




Summary

As an Analyst or Junior Associate, Analytics & Debt, you will directly support the Director of Analytics on a wide range of tasks ranging from investment valuations, portfolio analytics, investor reporting, investment operations, debt and ad hoc projects, providing you with the exposure to various real estate asset types and markets in the US. You will also be working closely with different departments and contribute to multiple cross-functional processes. Strong financial analysis/modeling skills and superior attention to detail are essential to this role, as well as the ability to manage time efficiently and prioritize among competing deadlines. Additionally, your strong work ethics and an eagerness to learn will support your continued growth in this role and advancement within the team.




This role requires 5 days in office at our San Francisco, CA location.




Interested candidates should send their resumes to Recruiting@divcore.com.




Responsibilities

Data & Analytics:

Gather, consolidate, and evaluate data from investment and accounting teams to perform portfolio/fund-level analytics with high accuracy and timeliness.
Support portfolio analytics, valuations, budgeting, investment operations, and related projects.
Assist with investor-related or fundraising initiatives in collaboration with the Capital Strategy & Formation team.
Ensure the integrity and completeness of asset-level track record details, supporting internal/external reporting and investor requests.

Financial & Investment Operations:

Facilitate the quarterly reporting process by collaborating with internal teams to ensure interim and final deadlines are met.
Support preparations for business plan meetings, the annual property budgeting process, and other related tasks.

Lender Coordination & Debt Management:

Assist with lender coordination efforts, including setting agendas for calls, updating contact lists in real-time, tracking lender conversations, and maintaining a master sheet for all deals and related lender details.
Maintain a weekly debt summary which provides key debt updates to the executive team.
Support the preparation and management of documents related to loan extensions, modifications, and new financings.

Cross-Functional Support:

Act as a key contributor to cross-departmental projects by collaborating with teams from Asset Management, Legal, and Accounting.
Participate in bi-weekly debt meetings, DRAC (Debt Review and Approval Committee), and other key meetings, providing note-taking support and tracking action items.
Assist with the DRAC process by tracking memos, following up on requests, and facilitating the flow of information across teams.

New Financings & Strategic Initiatives:

Support new financing efforts by assisting with the marketing of new deals, tracking lender bids, and ensuring that all new financing processes are well-organized and documented.

Ad Hoc Projects:

Take on additional responsibilities as needed, including ad hoc projects requested by the Director of Analytics or other senior leaders.




Qualifications

Bachelor’s or master’s degree in finance, Real Estate, Accounting, or Economics.
At least 1-2 years of relevant experience in real estate, investment banking, or finance.
Exceptional financial modeling skills. Exposure and/or knowledge of real estate accounting and financial statement analysis a plus.
Superior attention to detail and an eye for accuracy.
General understanding of financial analysis frameworks and economics / finance.
Ability to be efficient and precise with numbers and deliverables while managing multiple priorities.
Strong critical thinking skills. Ability to form logical arguments and conclusions, while being able validate such with facts and evidence.
Ability to work effectively as an independent contributor and as a team player.
Self-managed, high level of initiative, strong work ethic and eagerness to learn.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Advanced proficiency in Excel, Word, and PowerPoint. Working knowledge of Argus a plus.
The person in this position must be able to:
Remain in a stationary position for 75% of the time working on a computer and attending virtual meetings.
Occasionally move about the office to access file cabinets, office technology, and attend meetings etc.




Compensation

$115,000-$125,000
Annual bonus opportunity
Full benefits
401k
Unlimited paid time off
Weekly lunch stipend







Divco West Services, LLC (“Company”), an equal opportunity employer, is committed to equal opportunity for all employees and applicants. The Company recruits, hires, trains, promotes, pays, and administers all personnel actions without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), sex stereotyping (including assumptions about a person’s appearance or behavior, gender roles, gender expression, or gender identity), gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, mental or physical disability, ancestry, medical condition, marital status, military or veteran status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable law. We interpret these protected statuses broadly to include both the actual status and also any perceptions and assumptions made regarding these statuses. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. Please review our company Privacy Policy regarding the use of any personal information you provide us at: https://www.divcowest.com/privacy-policy/

This policy applies to all areas of employment, including recruitment, testing, screening, hiring, selection for training, upgrading, transfer, demotion, layoff, discipline, termination, compensation, benefits, and all other privileges, terms, and conditions of employment. This policy and the law prohibit employment discrimination against any employee or applicant on the basis of any legally protected status outlined above.

Title: Analyst – Retail Reporting & Insights
Description:
Job Description

Calling all originals: At Levi Strauss & Co., you can be yourself — and be part of something bigger. We’re a company of people who like to forge our own path and leave the world better than we found it. Who believe that what makes us different makes us stronger. So add your voice. Make an impact. Find your fit — and your future.

About The Job


Manage reporting for US/CA Retail leaders and retail teams
Assess current suite of reporting tools, identifying areas of opportunity, redundancy, and efficiency.
Work with IT, third-party vendors and other application owners to resolve data discrepancies.
Work with Global DTC, IT, Data Science and Business Intelligence teams to identify and implement new reporting solutions that meet the needs of our business partners and field teams.
Ensure consistency in data visibility and accuracy of all field facing reporting.
Support the Retail Operations team and other partners to reduce the number of manual reports created, develop consistency, and streamline the delivery of all reports through common tools and platforms.
Develop, maintain and distribute reports, dashboards, and materials for weekly, monthly and quarterly business reviews.
Conduct ad hoc analysis as needed to support the needs of the retail business and provide relevant insights to make critical business decisions.
Support the forecasting process and development of store level targets across a wide variety of programs and KPIs.
Turn business questions into functional analysis – understand the core impact regarding sales, profitability, and operational KPIs
Guide data-driven decision-making by extracting and aggregating data from multiple sources and translating it into relevant insights
You will report to the Sr Director, Retail and Omnichannel Operations.


About You


BS or MS degree in mathematics, engineering or statistics
2+ years of experience in a business analytics role. Retail industry experience.
Knowledge of the retail measurement ecosystem, including collecting, analyzing, summarizing data through API solutions
Intermediate to advanced proficiency in SQL and experience writing complex SQL queries
Experience with Data Visualization solutions using Tableau
Ability to manipulate large, complex data structures to meet business reporting requirements
Exceptional time and project management experience, including the ability to break down complex problems into milestones, prioritize work, maintain progress, and communicate status and results
Strong understanding of the retail business and KPIs (traffic, conversion, AUR, etc.)
Strong communication and presentation skills
Strong proficiency in excel (can perform complex functions) and PowerPoint required. SQL experience


This is a hybrid position based in our San Francisco, CA headquarters. You will be expected in office 3 days per week typically Tuesday-Thursday. Note, time in office can vary depending on business needs.

The expected starting salary range for this role is $67,200- $105,600 per year. We may ultimately pay more or less than the posted range based on the location of the role. The amount a particular employee will earn within the salary range will be based on factors such as relevant education, qualifications, performance and business needs.

Levi Strauss & Co. (LS&Co.) offers a total rewards package that includes base pay, incentive plans, 401(k) matching, paid leave, health insurance, product discounts, and more designed to help you and your family stay healthy, meet your financial goals, and balance the demands of your work and personal life. Available benefits and incentive compensation vary depending upon the specifics of the role; details relating to a specific role will be made available upon request. Read more about our benefits here.

LS&Co. is an affirmative action and equal employment opportunity employer. We welcome and value people from diverse cultures, backgrounds, and experiences to make LS&Co. a collective success.

EOE M/F/Disability/Vets

LOCATION

San Francisco, CA, USA

FULL TIME/PART TIME

Full time

Current LS&Co Employees, apply via your Workday account.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a Digital Data Analyst to join our Digital team, supporting leadership in generating business insights, creating reports, and providing recommendations to guide our digital merchandising strategy. This role will play a key part in recommending areas of opportunity within our KFC US app and website to increase conversion, reduce friction and impact customer behavior.

This role offers significant growth potential, making it ideal for someone looking to advance in the digital analytics space. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy working with data to drive business impact, we’d love to hear from you!

Job Responsibilites



Analyze digital merchandising performance on the KFC website and mobile app, optimizing promotional placements and customer journeys.
Monitor and report on menu item performance, LTOs (Limited-Time Offers), and promotional campaigns to inform marketing strategies.
Utilize KFC’s first-party data and customer insights to improve personalization and conversion rates.
Support order flow analysis and customer funnel optimization to increase digital sales and reduce cart abandonment.
Work closely with the KFC development team to ensure that web and app analytics are setup to properly track behavior on our digital assets
Create reports and dashboards within our analytics platform, Amplitude, that get shared out to key stakeholders across functional groups
Maintain and expand our Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager accounts to ensure accurate tracking back to our advertising partners
Collaborate with designers, product owners, and developers to improve the user experience on our digital platforms



Education/Certifications – Undergraduate degree in Marketing, Finance, Digital or related field

Experience

2-3 years of experience in the digital space



Strong analytical skills; able to identify key issues and contribute to strategic decisions
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Detail-oriented and highly motivated
Comfortable working independently and in a team environment
Preferred:

Experience in digital conversion rate optimization through multivariate testing
Experience working with CMS platforms
Experience working with the Google suite of ecommerce tools (Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, etc.)
Experience with Amplitude, PowerBI
Experience with mParticle, Treasure Data or other CDPs


KFC Corporation, based in Louisville, Kentucky, is one of the few brands in America that can boast about having a rich, 60-year history of success and innovation. In fact, KFC is the world's most popular chicken restaurant chain and a division of Yum! Brands, the world’s largest restaurant company.

Yum! Brands, Inc., based in Louisville, Kentucky, has over 45,000 restaurants in more than 135 countries and territories and is one of the Aon Hewitt Top Companies for Leaders in North America. In 2018, Yum! Brands was recognized as part of the inaugural Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index. The company’s restaurant brands – KFC, Pizza Hut and Taco Bell – are global leaders of the chicken, pizza and Mexican-style food categories.

More important than our size is our commitment to breakthrough innovation and the success of our employees. We're proud of the unique culture we've built, one where everyone can be their best self, make a difference and have fun! We believe in our people, trust in their positive intentions, encourage ideas from everyone, and have actively developed a workforce that is diverse in style and background.
Show more
HTML:
We are seeking a Digital Data Analyst to join our Digital team, supporting leadership in generating business insights, creating reports, and providing recommendations to guide our digital merchandising strategy. This role will play a key part in recommending areas of opportunity within our KFC US app and website to increase conversion, reduce friction and impact customer behavior.

This role offers significant growth potential, making it ideal for someone looking to advance in the digital analytics space. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment and enjoy working with data to drive business impact, we’d love to hear from you!

Job Responsibilites


  • Analyze digital merchandising performance on the KFC website and mobile app, optimizing promotional placements and customer journeys.
  • Monitor and report on menu item performance, LTOs (Limited-Time Offers), and promotional campaigns to inform marketing strategies.
  • Utilize KFC’s first-party data and customer insights to improve personalization and conversion rates.
  • Support order flow analysis and customer funnel optimization to increase digital sales and reduce cart abandonment.
  • Work closely with the KFC development team to ensure that web and app analytics are setup to properly track behavior on our digital assets
  • Create reports and dashboards within our analytics platform, Amplitude, that get shared out to key stakeholders across functional groups
  • Maintain and expand our Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager accounts to ensure accurate tracking back to our advertising partners
  • Collaborate with designers, product owners, and developers to improve the user experience on our digital platforms


Education/Certifications – Undergraduate degree in Marketing, Finance, Digital or related field

Experience

2-3 years of experience in the digital space


  • Strong analytical skills; able to identify key issues and contribute to strategic decisions
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Detail-oriented and highly motivated
  • Comfortable working independently and in a team environment
  • Preferred:
    • Experience in digital conversion rate optimization through multivariate testing
    • Experience working with CMS platforms
    • Experience working with the Google suite of ecommerce tools (Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, etc.)
    • Experience with Amplitude, PowerBI
    • Experience with mParticle, Treasure Data or other CDPs

KFC Corporation, based in Louisville, Kentucky, is one of the few brands in America that can boast about having a rich, 60-year history of success and innovation. In fact, KFC is the world's most popular chicken restaurant chain and a division of Yum! Brands, the world’s largest restaurant company.

Yum! Brands, Inc., based in Louisville, Kentucky, has over 45,000 restaurants in more than 135 countries and territories and is one of the Aon Hewitt Top Companies for Leaders in North America. In 2018, Yum! Brands was recognized as part of the inaugural Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index. The company’s restaurant brands – KFC, Pizza Hut and Taco Bell – are global leaders of the chicken, pizza and Mexican-style food categories.

More important than our size is our commitment to breakthrough innovation and the success of our employees. We're proud of the unique culture we've built, one where everyone can be their best self, make a difference and have fun! We believe in our people, trust in their positive intentions, encourage ideas from everyone, and have actively developed a workforce that is diverse in style and background.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Zest AI has been perfecting AI for consumer lending decisions since 2009. Our mission is to broaden access to equitable lending and our AI-enabled software creates some of the most inclusive risk models in the industry. Our Model Management System helps lenders make better decisions and better loans — increasing revenue, reducing risk, and automating compliance — while expanding credit access to deserving people with no added risk!




Our technology teams at Zest AI thrive on solving challenging problems that have a big impact on people's daily lives. We build tools to improve consumer lending by meeting the needs of financial institutions and their customers around the world. By leveraging a combination of machine learning and vast amounts of data, we seek to challenge traditional credit scoring models, while expanding the use of our proprietary technology across the fintech industry. Our team is committed to continuously leveraging and adapting the latest advances in AI/ML to benefit those we serve.







Job Description:

We are looking for Data Analysts, whether recent graduates or those early in their careers, to join our team. In this role, you will interpret and analyze complex data sets, develop actionable insights to drive business strategies, and effectively communicate findings to both technical and non-technical audiences. You will also manage projects, ensuring data-driven initiatives are completed on time and within scope.




As a Data Analyst, you will collaborate closely with Data Scientists, Software Engineers, and the Client Success team to deliver data solutions that exceed client expectations. Additionally, you’ll have the chance to lead various projects under the mentorship of senior team members, offering valuable opportunities for growth and development.




Responsibilities:

Analyze and interpret complex data sets and machine learning model results using advanced statistical techniques to identify relevant trends and patterns.
Translate model behavior and analytical findings into actionable business insight.
Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality.
Collaborate with senior members to prioritize work, promoting and supporting data-driven decision-making within the team.
Communicate findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders through standard and ad hoc. reports.







Requirements:

Expertise in data wrangling and manipulation in Python and SQL.
Solid understanding of machine learning and statistical analysis.
Good business acumen, with the ability to formulate approaches and solve complex business problems.
Strong coding skills, comfortable with Object-Oriented Programming.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to actively listen, incorporate feedback, and present complex ideas clearly and concisely.
Good project management skills, committed to maintaining quality and meeting deadlines, and willing to raise concerns if obstacles arise.
A [STEM] degree in fundamental mathematics is highly preferred – ie: Computer Science, Statistics, Engineering, etc.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst, Finance & Strategy, MarComms
Description:
Netflix is one of the world's leading entertainment services, with 283 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, films and games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can play, pause and resume watching as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, and can change their plans at any time.

Netflix is seeking a highly quantitative, driven, and intellectually curious associate to join our MarComms (Marketing & Communications) Finance & Strategy team. Our highly analytical approach to managing the company gives us a significant competitive advantage, and the F&S team plays a key role in this area. Senior leadership depends heavily on our F&S groups to accurately model and forecast the business and lead the strategic analysis that informs important business decisions.

This role will report to the Manager, MarComms F&S and sit in our Los Angeles office.

Responsibilities


Develop tools and analysis to support decision-making and inform MarComms investment allocation and strategy
Improve our data ecosystem and develop efficient ways for non-technical stakeholders to access and work with large data sets
Perform data analysis and develop insightful dashboards, memos, and presentations that summarize the data
Drive automation and reporting solutions via collaboration with business partners, Finance Technology, or Data Science & Engineering team
Act as the bridge between business teams and technical teams to gather system and data requirements


Qualifications


3- 5 years of experience in a highly analytical environment (e.g. finance, management consulting, business intelligence, corporate analytics, strategy and operations, or other roles requiring a blend of analytical, strategic, and cross-functional work)
Hands-on experience or working knowledge of data-oriented programming languages (e.g. SQL, Python, R, etc.)
Strong analytical skills and an ability to synthesize information across a broad ecosystem to diagnose problems and devise solutions
Comfortable and effective in ambiguous problem spaces; you connect the dots across business needs and independently drive projects forward
Strong communicator; able to collaborate and maintain relationships with partners on both business teams and technical teams


Nice to haves


Experience in data reporting and visualization using tools such as Tableau, Plotly, Power BI, R, Python, etc.
Experience with complex data types, using Common Table Expressions (CTEs), or leveraging window functions


Our compensation structure consists solely of an annual salary; we do not have bonuses. You choose each year how much of your compensation you want in salary versus stock options. To determine your personal top of market compensation, we rely on market indicators and consider your specific job family, background, skills, and experience to determine your compensation in the market range. The range for this role is $50,000-240,000.

Netflix provides comprehensive benefits including Health Plans, Mental Health support, a 401(k) Retirement Plan with employer match, Stock Option Program, Disability Programs, Health Savings and Flexible Spending Accounts, Family-forming benefits, and Life and Serious Injury Benefits. We also offer paid leave of absence programs. Full-time hourly employees accrue 35 days annually for paid time off to be used for vacation, holidays, and sick paid time off. Full-time salaried employees are immediately entitled to flexible time off. See more detail about our Benefits here.

Netflix is a unique culture and environment. Learn more here.

Inclusion is a Netflix value and we strive to host a meaningful interview experience for all candidates. If you want an accommodation/adjustment for a disability or any other reason during the hiring process, please send a request to your recruiting partner.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, ancestry, national origin, caste, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, age, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic makeup, marital status, or military service.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create digital marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realize their financial goals and help them to save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland.

Job Description

Reporting into Manager of Data Applications, you will produce analysis, design and implement well tested data solutions to meet requirements with the assistance of senior team members.

What you'll do?


Work within a Data Scrum team to complete the ETL processes and perform audits to assess data quality and structure, focusing on the products we are responsible for.
Provide ongoing support for systems and products, addressing queries or issues related to data builds managed by the team.
Understand the structure and relationships within the data.
Collaborate in the initiation and implementation of automated solutions, including coding and testing, with support from senior team members.
Report any issues to senior team members and propose potential solutions to ensure resolution.
Ensure testing is conducted at each stage of the data development process to maintain data integrity.
Create clear, accurate, and concise documentation for supported products.
Work with experts from different fields, such as Data Science, Modeling, Software Development, GIS, and QA, to develop the best solutions.
Partner with project owners to ensure smooth project execution and delivery, contributing to the successful completion of each project.


Qualifications

What you'll bring?


A background in database technologies, including design and data manipulation.
Basic programming and development skills.
Proficiency in MS excel (can maintain complex spreadsheets).
Experience or familiarity with SQL.
Experience or familiarity with Python programming.
Data managing skills for development tasks within a project.
Excellent numeracy skills.
Develop expertise in your field to provide valuable guidance and contribute to the division's business success.


Additional Information

You will get:


Personal Development - career pathway for professional growth supported by learning and development programs and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials and books.
Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized strong team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
Social benefit package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance, monthly flex allowance and internet coverage, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many other benefits!
Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in Social responsibility event.
Opportunity for Flexible working hours and Home Office.


Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, provide digital marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to accomplish their financial goals and help them to save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in accomplished people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data and improve. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland.

Job Description

What you'll be doing:

You will provide data processing, services and solutions, within a data environment, to businesses with simple and complex needs. You will work for clients across many sectors including Banking, Financial Services and Automotive.


Engage with Account Managers and clients to ensure requirements and data deliveries are understood and fulfilled to expectations.
Demonstrates effective communication and collaboration with internal and external stakeholders to ensure high quality deliveries to our clients
Run simple and complex batch processes to deliver data to clients.
Simple and complex coding to extract data from files to underpin data activities.
Involvement in delivery of high-quality work within agreed timescales, contributing to overall client project goals
Provision of counts and profile analysis to support campaign and strategic activity for clients
Manage creating, modifying and monitoring of automated processes for clients
Maintain the codebase and incorporate any new developments


You will report into the Senior Delivery Consultant

Qualifications

What you'll need to bring:


University degree with a high numerical content (such as Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics, etc.);
Experience of SQL
Demonstrate analytical thinking with experience solving numerical and data problem
Understanding of data, data structures and their value regarding use for data processing and data delivery
Experienced in building relationships with colleagues by email, phone, video conference and face-to-face meetings
Experience managing multiple tasks
Fluent English


Additional Information

What you will get:


Personal Development - career pathway for professional growth supported by learning and development programs and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials & book.
Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
Social benefit package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance, monthly flex allowance and internet coverage, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, а birthday gift and many other benefits!
Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in Social responsibility event.
Opportunity for Flexible working hours and Home Office.


Experian is an Equal opportunity employer. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Your digital journey starts here!




Create. Grow. Deliver our story to millions.

#BTCode, where technology meets creativity. Code is our universal language and innovation is the fuel that propels us into the future. 🚀




Job Summary:

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team.

This role involves working closely with business stakeholders to understand and document their requirements, analyze data, and support the development of data warehouse (DW) structures and reporting solutions.




Responsibilities:

Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their data needs and translate them into technical requirements.
Document detailed requirements for data warehouse developments, ensuring clarity and completeness.
Work closely with DW developers to design and validate new data structures required for reporting and analytics.
Test data structures during system migrations to ensure data integrity, accuracy, and alignment with business requirements.
Develop and execute test cases and validate results to confirm the success of data migration or transformation processes.
Maintain comprehensive documentation in tools like Confluence, detailing data requirements, solutions, and testing processes.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, data engineers, and external vendors, to deliver high-quality solutions.
Actively use Jira and Clarity to track tasks, document progress, and ensure timely delivery of projects.
Ensure adherence to data governance policies and maintain high standards for data accuracy and security.
Advocate for and implement best practices in data analysis and reporting.
Provide ad-hoc analysis and insights as needed to support decision-making processes.
Assist in troubleshooting and resolving data-related issues.




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Economics, Information Systems, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Analyst, Business Analyst, or similar role, with a focus on data (1 year).
Experience with data warehouse development and reporting.
Good with SQL for data extraction and analysis.
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Qlik Sense).
Knowledge of Jira, Confluence, and Clarity.
Understanding of data modeling and ETL processes.




If you want to find out what other jobs we still have available, like Life at BT or what #Culture BT is, you can also access the Bank's career website: https://cariere.bancatransilvania.ro/ .
